greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of the arithmetic mean of the divisors of A003961(n).
comment: All terms are odd because A336932(n) = A007814(A003973(n)) >= A295664(n) for all n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: a(n) = d(n)/A336856(n) = d(n)/gcd(d(n),A003973(n)) = d(n)/gcd(d(n),A336841(n)), where d(n) is the number of divisors of n, A000005(n).
For all primes p, and e >= 0, a(A000225(e)) = a(p^((2^e) - 1)) = 1. [See A336856]
It seems that for all odd primes p, and with the exponents e=5, 11, 17 or 23 (at least these), a(p^e) = 1.
It seems that a(27^((2^n)-1)) = A052940(n-1) for all n >= 1.
program: A003961(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 07 2020
